title: Watch: Does liking tomboys make you gay?!
description:
Does liking a tomboy make you gay? An influencer named Sameera Khan appears to think so.

Does Liking Tomboys Make You G@y?! www.youtube.com

Khan posted a video of a ‚Äútomboy,‚Äù stating she had a problem with the women's country accent, as well as the fact that she was showing viewers a house that she was building with her dad, claiming that she was not ‚Äúfeminine‚Äù enough by her standards.

title: Library offers amnesty for library late fees... providing you pay them back in cat pictures
description:
There is inflation and then there is hyperinflation. We have yet to see the latter, but that does not mean people are not greatly affected by the fact that their purchasing power only keeps decreasing.

Librarians tend to have a love for reading - obviously. And when you love something you often want other people to join in on the fun. This is why a Machessutes library has decided that rather than pay late fees, members can avoid these fines in exchange for cat pictures.

We shall call this ‚ÄúOnly Paws.‚Äù

And before you haters out there say that this is discriminatory because you have a dog - the picture can be of any cat. You can draw one, pull one off Google, or tell a librarian a story about a cat.

‚Äî (@)

title: Homesteading content creator claps back at troll account who claimed she's not feminine: "I don‚Äôt have a clue who she is"
description:
Stop me if you heard this one before. A girl posts a video of her doing things on the internet. An X-Twitter troll shares it and attacks her for it. Everyone else has an opinion and it becomes all anyone is talking about. Our most recent example of this is Hannah Barron vs. Samirah Khan, and a video I guarantee you've seen while scrolling.

Hannah is someone who likes to hunt, fish, and build homes with her dad. Samirah describes herself as a news analyst who is a part of something called the "Abrahamic Alliance Against Globalism." Samirah shared a video of Hannah working on a home and used her to attack all American women, who are, quote, "literally men."

It implies people who find Hannah to be a catch are "gay," which is funny because a lot of the "red-pill bros" sound like they're the ones who like the cock. Or are at least cock-curious.

title: Dana Carvey nails FLAWLESS Biden impersonation about the border crisis, complete with jibberish and everything
description:
Subscribe to Louder with Crowder on Rumble! Download the app on Apple and Google Play.

There is a lot of chirping out on these internet streets today about Jimmy Kimmel on the Oscars. Kimmel, who hosts the progressive political podcast "Jimmy Kimmel Live," said a bunch of things that a) weren't funny, b) isn't surprising, since Kimmel hasn't been funny since The Man Show, and c) it was the Oscars, so meh. Instead of wasting bandwidth over someone who I'm already bored with, let's focus on a comedian who ackshually is funny. Dana Carvey.

Carvey does a podcast with David Spade called "Superfly" and he nailed a perfect J
